unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: Point Estimate for the Slope Given a Table
question_text: Is there an association between someone eating large quantities of chocolate and being overweight? A random sample of $26$ women had their body fat percentage measured and were also were asked how much chocolate they eat a day. A computer regression analysis of the data is given below: Dependent variable is: Body fat $R^2 = 20.26\%$ $s= 7.89 $ Variable Coefficient s.e Coeff t-ratio prob Constant 23.231 1.567 14.32 0.00001 Chocolate 0.0543 0.0217 2.21 0.037 Assuming the conditions have been satisfied and using $95\%$ confidence, which of the following represents the point estimate for the slope $t$ -interval?
